Summary: In the ESE sky, it looks like 4 Venus's in one. No sound or movement.
trends: There have been 29 other sightings in Levittown
There were no other sightings in Levittown on or around September 8th 2010
divs: Sighting DetailsHi - I happened to go outside to roll up the sun shade tonight; it's getting windy and it was banging against the kitchen window. I looked up at the stars, since it's been a while, and I wanted to see what constellations I could recognize. Turning around, I see this VERY bright light staying stationary in the sky, ESE from Levittown, PA where I am. It's like 4 or 5 Venus's in one, when it's close to the earth. 20 minutes I check again and it's still there. My brother's already asleep or I'd get his telescope. There is no sound or movement that I can tell, since the pine tree branches are waving about. Planes with their lights have passed near it, so it's not a plane. I never saw anything like it. Now it's 20 minutes later and it's STILL there. I do believe we're not alone in the universe, and naturally, I very curious about this.
